title: How to Make Aniseed Cake

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 150ºC/300ºF.
steps.description: Line or grease the cake pan.

steps.headline: Melt the butter in the saucepan over low heat.
steps.description: Add the sugar and stir to melt.

steps.headline: Pour the sugar and butter mixture into the mixing bowl.
steps.description: Add the sugar and salt and mix through.

steps.headline: Stir in the aniseed oil drops.
Pour the cake batter into the cake pan.
steps.description: Use the spatula to remove any mixture left stuck to the bowl.

steps.headline: Place in the oven.
steps.description: Bake for one hour or until a skewer inserted into the cake comes out clean.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven.
steps.description: Leave to cool on a wire baking rack for 5 minutes, then remove from the pan and leave to cool on the rack out of the pan.

text: Preheat the oven to 150ºC/300ºF. Line or grease the cake pan. Melt the butter in the saucepan over low heat. Add the sugar and stir to melt. Pour the sugar and butter mixture into the mixing bowl. Add the sugar and salt and mix through. Stir in the aniseed oil drops. Add the honey or syrup. Sift in the flour. Mix well. Pour the cake batter into the cake pan. Use the spatula to remove any mixture left stuck to the bowl. Place in the oven. Bake for one hour or until a skewer inserted into the cake comes out clean. Remove from the oven. Leave to cool on a wire baking rack for 5 minutes, then remove from the pan and leave to cool on the rack out of the pan. Finished.
